audio.title: <audio>
audio.description: The HTML <audio> element is used to embed sound content in documents.

background-color.title: background-color
background-color.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element, either through a color value or the keyword transparent.

background-image.title: background-image
background-image.description: The CSS background-image property sets one or several background images for an element.

background-position.title: background-position
background-position.description: The background-position CSS property sets the initial position, relative to the background position layer defined by background-origin for each defined background image.

background-repeat.title: background-repeat
background-repeat.description: The background-repeat CSS property defines how background images are repeated.

background-size.title: background-size
background-size.description: The background-size CSS property specifies the size of the background images.

border-collapse.title: border-collapse
border-collapse.description: The border-collapse CSS property determines whether a table's borders are separated or collapsed.

border-color.title: border-color
border-color.description: The border-color CSS property is a shorthand for setting the color of the four sides of an element's border

border-image.title: border-image
border-image.description: The border-image CSS property allows drawing an image on the borders of elements.

border-radius.title: border-radius
border-radius.description: The border-radius CSS property allows Web authors to define how rounded border corners are.

border-spacing.title: border-spacing
border-spacing.description: The border-spacing CSS property specifies the distance between the borders of adjacent table cells

border.title: border
border.description: The border CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual border property values in a single place in the style sheet. border can be used to set the values for one or more of: border-width, border-style, border-color.

bottom.title: bottom
bottom.description: The bottom CSS property participates in specifying the position of positioned elements.

box-shadow.title: box-shadow
box-shadow.description: The box-shadow property describes one or more shadow effects as a comma-separated list

canvas.title: <canvas>
canvas.description: The HTML <canvas> Element can be used to draw graphics via scripting (usually JavaScript)

caption-side.title: caption-side
caption-side.description: The caption-side CSS property positions the content of a table's <caption> on the specified side.

clear.title: clear
clear.description: The clear CSS property specifies whether an element can be next to floating elements that precede it or must be moved down (cleared) below them.

clip.title: clip
clip.description: The clip CSS property defines what portion of an element is visible.

color.title: color
color.description: The color property sets the foreground color of an element's text content, and its decorations.

colors-hsl.title: HSL color values
colors-hsl.description: HSL colors are encoding as a triple (hue, saturation, lightness).

colors-hsla.title: HSLA color values
colors-hsla.description: Just as the ‘rgb()’ functional notation has the ‘rgba()’ alpha counterpart, the ‘hsl()’ functional notation has the ‘hsla()’ alpha counterpart.

colors-rgba.title: RGBA color values
colors-rgba.description: The RGB color model is extended in this specification to include “alpha” to allow specification of the opacity of a color.

cursor.title: cursor
cursor.description: The cursor CSS property specifies the mouse cursor displayed when the mouse pointer is over an element.

direction.title: direction
direction.description: Set the direction CSS property to match the direction of the text: rtl for languages written from right-to-left (like Hebrew or Arabic) text and ltr for other scripts.

display.title: display
display.description: The display CSS property specifies the type of rendering box used for an element.

empty-cells.title: empty-cells
empty-cells.description: The empty-cells CSS property specifies how user agents should render borders and backgrounds around cells that have no visible content.

float.title: float
float.description: The float CSS property specifies that an element should be taken from the normal flow and placed along the left or right side of its container, where text and inline elements will wrap around it.

font-face.title: @font-face
font-face.description: The @font-face CSS at-rule allows authors to specify online fonts to display text on their web pages

font-family.title: font-family
font-family.description: The font-family CSS property lets you specify a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names for the selected element.

font-size.title: font-size
font-size.description: The font-size CSS property specifies the size of the font

font-style.title: font-style
font-style.description: The font-style CSS property lets you select italic or oblique faces within a font-family.

font-variant.title: font-variant
font-variant.description: This property acts as a shorthand for the longhand properties: font-variant-caps, font-variant-numeric, font-variant-alternates, font-variant-ligatures, and font-variant-east-asian.

font-weight.title: font-weight
font-weight.description: The font-weight CSS property specifies the weight or boldness of the font.

font.title: font
font.description: The font CSS property is either a shorthand property for setting font-style, font-variant, font-weight, font-size, line-height and font-family, or a way to set the element's font to a system font, using specific keywords.

height.title: height
height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of the content area of an element.

left.title: left
left.description: The left CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements.

letter-spacing.title: letter-spacing
letter-spacing.description: The letter-spacing CSS property specifies spacing behavior between text characters.

line-height.title: line-height
line-height.description: On block level elements, the line-height property specifies the minimum height of line boxes within the element.

link-in-body.title: <link> element in <body>
link-in-body.description: The HTML Link Element (<link>) specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource

link-in-head.title: <link> element in <head>
link-in-head.description: The HTML Link Element (<link>) specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource

list-style-image.title: list-style-image
list-style-image.description: The list-style-image property specifies an image to be used as the list item marker.

list-style-position.title: list-style-position
list-style-position.description: The list-style-position property specifies the position of the marker box in the principal block box.

list-style-type.title: list-style-type
list-style-type.description: The list-style-type property specifies the appearance of a list item element

margin.title: margin
margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin for all four sides.

max-width.title: max-width
max-width.description: The max-width property is used to set the maximum width of a given element.

media-queries.title: @media
media-queries.description: The @media rule is used to define different style rules for different media types/devices.

min-width.title: min-width
min-width.description: The min-width property is used to set the minimum width of a given element.

opacity.title: opacity
opacity.description: The opacity CSS property specifies the transparency of an element, that is, the degree to which the background behind the element is overlaid.

outline.title: outline
outline.description: The CSS outline property is a shorthand property for setting one or more of the individual outline properties outline-style, outline-width and outline-color in a single declaration

overflow.title: overflow
overflow.description: The overflow property specifies whether to clip content, render scrollbars or just display content when it overflows its block level container.

padding.title: padding
padding.description: The padding property sets the padding space on all sides of an element.

position.title: position
position.description: The position CSS property chooses alternative rules for positioning elements

pseudo-class-active.title: CSS pseudo-class :active
pseudo-class-active.description: The :active CSS pseudo-class matches when an element is being activated by the user. It allows the page to give a feedback that the activation has been detected by the browser

pseudo-class-empty.title: CSS pseudo-class :empty
pseudo-class-empty.description: The :empty pseudo-class represents any element that has no children at all. Only element nodes and text (including whitespace) are considered. Comments or processing instructions do not affect whether an element is considered empty or not

pseudo-class-first-child.title: CSS pseudo-class :first-child
pseudo-class-first-child.description: The :first-child CSS pseudo-class represents any element that is the first child element of its parent.

pseudo-class-first-of-type.title: CSS pseudo-class :first-of-type
pseudo-class-first-of-type.description: The :first-of-type CSS pseudo-class represents the first sibling of its type in the list of children of its parent element.

pseudo-class-focus.title: CSS pseudo-class :focus
pseudo-class-focus.description: The :focus CSS pseudo-class is applied when a element has received focus, either from the user selecting it with the use of a keyboard or by activating with the mouse (e.g. a form input).

pseudo-class-hover.title: CSS pseudo-class :hover
pseudo-class-hover.description: The :hover CSS pseudo-class matches when the user designates an element with a pointing device, but does not necessarily activate it.

pseudo-class-last-child.title: CSS pseudo-class :last-child
pseudo-class-last-child.description: The :last-child CSS pseudo-class represents any element that is the last child element of its parent.

pseudo-class-last-of-type.title: CSS pseudo-class :last-of-type
pseudo-class-last-of-type.description: The :last-of-type CSS pseudo-class represents the last sibling with the given element name in the list of children of its parent element.

pseudo-class-link.title: CSS pseudo-class :link
pseudo-class-link.description: The :link CSS pseudo-class lets you select links inside elements. This will select any link which has not yet been visited, even those already styled using selector with other link-related pseudo-classes like :hover, :active or :visited.

pseudo-class-not.title: CSS pseudo-class :not()
pseudo-class-not.description: The negation CSS pseudo-class, :not(X), is a functional notation taking a simple selector X as an argument. It matches an element that is not represented by the argument. X must not contain another negation selector.

pseudo-class-nth-child.title: CSS pseudo-class :nth-child
pseudo-class-nth-child.description: The :nth-child(an+b) CSS pseudo-class matches an element that has an+b-1 siblings before it in the document tree, for a given positive or zero value for n, and has a parent element. More simply stated, the selector matches a number of child elements whose numeric position in the series of children matches the pattern an+b.

pseudo-class-nth-last-child.title: CSS pseudo-class :nth-last-child
pseudo-class-nth-last-child.description: The :nth-last-child CSS pseudo-class matches an element that has an+b-1 siblings after it in the document tree, for a given positive or zero value for n, and has a parent element.

pseudo-class-nth-last-of-type.title: CSS pseudo-class :nth-last-of-type
pseudo-class-nth-last-of-type.description: The :nth-last-of-type CSS pseudo-class matches an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same element name after it in the document tree, for a given positive or zero value for n, and has a parent element.

pseudo-class-nth-of-type.title: CSS pseudo-class :nth-of-type
pseudo-class-nth-of-type.description: The :nth-of-type CSS pseudo-class matches an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same element name before it in the document tree, for a given positive or zero value for n, and has a parent element.

pseudo-class-target.title: CSS pseudo-class :target
pseudo-class-target.description: The :target pseudo-class represents the unique element, if any, with an id matching the fragment identifier of the URI of the document..

pseudo-class-visited.title: CSS pseudo-class :visited
pseudo-class-visited.description: The :visited CSS pseudo-class lets you select only links that have been visited.

pseudo-element-after.title: CSS pseudo-class ::after (:after)
pseudo-element-after.description: The CSS ::after pseudo-element matches a virtual last child of the selected element. It is typically used to add cosmetic content to an element by using the content CSS property.

pseudo-element-before.title: CSS pseudo-element ::before (:before)
pseudo-element-before.description: ::before creates a pseudo-element that is the first child of the element matched. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element by using the content property.

pseudo-element-first-letter.title: CSS pseudo-element ::first-letter (:first-letter)
pseudo-element-first-letter.description: The ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element selects the first letter of the first line of a block, if it is not preceded by any other content (such as images or inline tables) on its line.

pseudo-element-first-line.title: CSS pseudo-element ::first-line(:first-line)
pseudo-element-first-line.description: The ::first-line CSS pseudo-element applies styles only to the first line of an element.

resize.title: resize
resize.description: The resize CSS property lets you control the resizability of an element.

right.title: right
right.description: The right CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements.

selector-adjacent.title: CSS adjacent selector
selector-adjacent.description: This is referred to as an adjacent selector. It will select only the specified element that immediately follows the former specified element.

selector-attribute-begins.title: CSS attribute selector [attr^=value]
selector-attribute-begins.description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr and whose value is prefixed by "value".

selector-attribute-contain.title: CSS attribute selector [attr~=value]
selector-attribute-contain.description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr whose value is a whitespace-separated list of words, one of which is exactly "value".

selector-attribute-ends.title: CSS attribute selector [attr$=value]
selector-attribute-ends.description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr and whose value is suffixed by "value".

selector-attribute-match.title: CSS attribute selector [attr=value]
selector-attribute-match.description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr and whose value is exactly "value".

selector-attribute-substring.title: CSS attribute selector [attr*=value]
selector-attribute-substring.description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr and whose value contains at least one occurrence of string "value" as substring.

selector-attribute.title: CSS attribute selector [attr]
selector-attribute.description: Represents an element with an attribute name of attr.

selector-child.title: CSS child selector
selector-child.description: The > combinator separates two selectors and matches only those elements matched by the second selector that are direct children of elements matched by the first.

selector-class.title: CSS class selector
selector-class.description: In an HTML document, CSS class selectors match an element based on the contents of the element's class attribute

selector-descendant.title: CSS descendant selector
selector-descendant.description: The ␣ combinator (that's meant to represent a space, or more properly one or more whitespace characters) combines two selectors such that the combined selector matches only those elements matching the second selector for which there is an ancestor element matching the first selector. Descendant selectors are similar to child selectors, but they do not require that the relationship between matched elements be strictly parent-child.

selector-element-type.title: CSS type selector
selector-element-type.description: CSS type selectors match elements by node name

selector-id.title: CSS id selector
selector-id.description: In an HTML document, CSS ID selectors match an element based on the contents of that element's ID attribute, which must match exactly the value given in the selector.

selector-sibling.title: CSS general sibling selector
selector-sibling.description: The ~ combinator separates two selectors and matches the second element only if it is preceded by the first, and both share a common parent.

selector-universal.title: CSS universal selector (asterisk)
selector-universal.description: An Asterisk (*) is the universal selector for CSS. It matches a single element of any type.

style-in-body.title: <style> element in <body>
style-in-body.description: The HTML Style Element (<style>) contains style information for a document, or part of a document.

style-in-head.title: <style> element in <head>
style-in-head.description: The HTML Style Element (<style>) contains style information for a document, or part of a document.

table-layout.title: table-layout
table-layout.description: The table-layout CSS property defines the algorithm to be used to layout the table cells, rows, and columns.

text-align.title: text-align
text-align.description: The text-align CSS property describes how inline content like text is aligned in its parent block element.

text-decoration.title: text-decoration
text-decoration.description: The text-decoration CSS property is used to set the text formatting to underline, overline, line-through or blink.

text-indent.title: text-indent
text-indent.description: The text-indent property specifies how much horizontal space should be left before the beginning of the first line of the text content of an element.

text-overflow.title: text-overflow
text-overflow.description: The text-overflow property determines how overflowed content that is not displayed is signaled to users.

text-shadow.title: text-shadow
text-shadow.description: The text-shadow property adds shadows to text.

text-transform.title: text-transform
text-transform.description: The text-transform CSS property specifies how to capitalize an element's text.

top.title: top
top.description: The top CSS property specifies part of the position of positioned elements.

vertical-align.title: vertical-align
vertical-align.description: The vertical-align CSS property specifies the vertical alignment of an inline or table-cell box.

video.title: <video>
video.description: The HTML <video> element is used to embed video content.

visibility.title: visibility
visibility.description: The visibility property can be used to hide an element while leaving the space where it would have been.

white-space.title: white-space
white-space.description: The white-space property is used to describe how whitespace inside the element is handled.

width.title: width
width.description: The width CSS property specifies the width of the content area of an element.

word-spacing.title: word-spacing
word-spacing.description: The word-spacing property specifies spacing behavior between tags and words.

word-wrap.title: word-wrap
word-wrap.description: The word-wrap property is used to specify whether or not the browser may break lines within words in order to prevent overflow when an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit in its containing box.

z-index.title: z-index
z-index.description: The z-index property specifies the z-order of an element and its descendants.
